content:
I have added a new example code system and value set by adding XML files in the resource folder.

In my local build these show up as a new generated page e.g.
.../gittrunk/fhir/publish/valueset-warning-type.html
and the model using this value set has a local link to it, which works.

But once committed to the main build it works differently.

That page isn't being created and also the link is different - it goes directly to hl7.org instead of a page within build.fhir.org
e.g. http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/warning-type
Which is not there.

Another value set (also currently specific to this resource) linked from the same page works fine. Is this now different with UTG? Is there a setting somewhere that says "make this a local page"?
no it sounds like something isn't properly identified
yes, but it's odd that it works fine in a local build. Hard to know where to look to fix it.
Simple fix - actually commit the value set! Missing out these files does not cause a build error.
